Hey jon your tank will probably be featured in this one.

> 
> @Columbia Actually I forgot task what image editing programs do you use?

I used Autodesk Sketchbook.. with a tablet and stylus.

A basis image is taken - Say, if you want to "cartoonize" a Space Shuttle, take an image of one that you want it to look like.

Import it in Sketchbook, and place a new layer on top of it. 

To start, "pick" the color from the base image - Best advised to put as few outlines as possible. 

Once that's done, lower the opacity of the base image to around 50 percent, and trace the image. If you need to get a new color from it, put back the opacity to 100, and pick the color.. Make sure it's filled in and with as few outlines as possible.

Here's an example of a Cathay Pacific B777 I did just today (which was the most painstaking and tiring Sketchbook project I ever did)

![ZKobm9f.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/ZKobm9f.jpg)

The base image: 

![Cathay_Pacific_Boeing_777-300ER_(7055258465)_(2).jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/b/b9/Cathay_Pacific_Boeing_777-300ER_(7055258465)_(2).jpg)

Well, of course.. you know the rest.

Cathay Pacific, your livery is a pain to draw.

From where do you pull your crafts? The Rep thread, people's company pages?

> 
> From where do you pull your crafts? The Rep thread, people's company pages?

The entire spacecraft exchange. You can sort how many threads show by how long they were posted in. If that is set to one week, you get all the craft.
